titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: Toothache during the night made me "a wreck" in the morning, but notwithstanding I celebrated the Holy Communion in the Chapel at 8 a.m.
I addressed the candidates on "The Preparation and Delivery of Sermons", and later I delivered to them in the Deanery Chapel the accustomed charge.

The Bishop of Jarrow carried me to Durham in his motor, and I put up for the night in my rooms at the Castle. At 4.15 p.m. I admitted Herbert to the new district of Easington Colliery, having first attended Evensong in the Cathedral. I sate behind the Font unobserved, and enjoyed the music. At 6 p.m. I witnessed the legal subscriptions of the candidates in the Chapter House, & afterwards dined with the Bishop & Mrs Knight.

p.hi: J. H. Warner) has written in his parish magazine about the Mission of Healing which Hickson is to conduct in his parish on Oct. 13â€“15. His letter, reproduced in the "Yorkshire Post", gives me the impression of a sincere stupid enthusiastick man, who finds in the ardour of his own feelings a sufficient evidence of the Divine origin of his notions & projects. He has evidently been considerably criticised.
